title:
Absence of Normal Heat Conduction in Strongly Disordered Interacting
  Quantum Chains
authors: Wojciech De Roeck, Lydia Giacomin, Francois Huveneers, Oskar Prosniak
abstract:
We prove that in strongly disordered, interacting, quantum chains, the
conductance of a chain of length $L$ vanishes faster than $1/L$. This means
that transport is anomalous in such chains. This phenomenon was first claimed
in \cite{Basko2006,gornyi2005interacting} and a pioneering treatment appeared
in \cite{Imbrie2016a}
subjects: Condensed Matter/Disordered Systems and Neural Networks
